item.description:
A trip is in the discussion stages to go to New York City for the big events that are planned for the weekend before 9/11 and for that day. You can join the discussion here.

[as of 7 September, Friday, there is no organized van or bus trip going to NYC from New-Hampshire that we know of. Individuals wanting to go and wanting to join up on transportation costs should call Jack at 233-1058. We could also try using http://www.erideshare... - it looks like a cool service. No matter what the transpo turns out to be, Jack can meet others at Cooper Union at 1PM Saturday.]

Details regarding the 2 big conferences are coming together - links below:

We Are Change conference and Fundraiser for First Responders
Featuring Alex Jones, Jack Blood, Gary Franchi, Jason Bermas, Dylan Avery, Ed Brown (phone), John Feal. Aaron Russo (RIP) was scheduled as a tentative, but passed away recently - he will be missed.
Loose Change, Final Cut will be premiered on the 10th and Alex Jones' new video, End Game will also be premiered.

New York 911 Truth conference - "9/11 Truth: Ready For Mainstream Weekend"
Will feature: Richard Gage - Architects & Engineers For 9/11 Truth
Webster Tarpley - Historian, Author
William Pepper, Esq. - International Attorney, author of "Act of State"
Alfred Webre - Attorney, organizer of International Tribunal on 9/11
Ralph Schoenman & Mya Shone - hosts of Taking Aim Radio
Kevin Barrett - Professor of Islamic Studies
Jim Fetzer - Founder of Scholars For 9/11 Truth
Sofia - Producer of "9/11 Mysteries"
Craig Ranke, Citizen Investigation Team, Researcher and
Co-Creator of The PentaCon
Bernard White - Station manager, WBAI
Frank Morales - Pastor, Winner of "2007 Project Censored" Award
Peter Thottam, Esq. - Impeachment & 9/11 Truth Activist
Robin Hordon - Former Flight Controller

-------
Suggestions of how to make it an economical trip are welcomed on the discussion linked to above.

Some want to leave on Friday afternoon and stay all the way through til Tuesday evening - what's the feeling of others? ==> discussion here

--------
CARPOOLING, LODGING and other details not available for the group as a whole due to no organized plan being put together.

Inexpensive bus transportation from Boston to NYC is available from Fung Wah (the Chinatown bus) @ $15 each way.

Inexpensive lodging available at the HI Hostel at 103rd and Amsterdam in Manhattan for $29/night, though it books early.
item.name: Trip to New York City - Ground Zero
